titlepage.titleproper: Finding aid for the Barbara Aziz broadcasts collection
titlepage.author: Finding aid created by Steven Gentry, February 2022

did.abstract:
Dr. Barbara Nimri Aziz is an Arab American author, anthropologist, and journalist. She founded Radio Tahrir, which broadcasted regularly from circa 1990-2013 over New York City's WBAI Radio. Radio Tahrir was the first radio program in the United States to focus on a wide range of topics pertaining to different Arab and Muslim communities across the world.
The materials in this collection are dated from 1988-2014 and include broadcast episodes and episode segments as well as commentaries, documentaries, interviews, news reports, and literary recitations.
did.langmaterial: The material is primarily in English, with some material in Arabic, French, and the languages of Iran.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open without restriction.

acqinfo.p: Donated by Dr. Barbara Nimri Aziz (donor no. 11042) in November 2017.

userestrict.p: Donor(s) have transferred any applicable copyright to the Regents of the University of Michigan but the collection may contain third-party materials for which copyright was not transferred. Patrons are responsible for determining the appropriate use or reuse of materials.

The Donor's assignment of copyright in the Radio Tahrir audio files to the Library is subject to the reservation that the Donor may utilize the Radio Tahrir audio files for the remainder of her lifetime in the manner in which it has heretofore been utilized, which includes but is not limited to the right to make the Radio Tahrir audio files available to the public on www.radiotahrir.org, the right to retain copies of the Radio Tahrir audio files, and the right to use the Radio Tahrir audio files for personal or educational purposes.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was largely created using metadata and biographical information submitted by Dr. Barbara Nimri Aziz.

arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into 3 series: 1. Radio Tahrir and related material. 2. News broadcasts. 3. Interviews and related material.

bioghist.p: Barbara Nimri Aziz was born in Ontario, Canada, in 1940. In 1962, she graduated from Queens University in Kingston, Ontario, with a Bachelor in Arts degree in Biology. Aziz then traveled to India and spent several years assisting Tibetan refugees fleeing Chinese control of Tibet. This work inspired her interest in anthropology. In 1969, she enrolled at the University of London's School of Oriental and African Studies (SOAS). She received a Ph.D. in Anthropology from the SOAS in 1974. Her thesis was entitled "The people of Dingri: a socio-historical portrait of a district in S.W. Tibet."

In circa March 1990, Dr. Aziz established the Radio Tahrir radio magazine, which broadcasted over New York City's WBAI Radio, an affiliate of the Pacifica Radio Network. Radio Tahrir (Radio "Liberation") was the first radio program in the United States dedicated to Arab culture and society. Originally, the program focused on uplifting the voices of members of different Arab communities from around the world. It expanded its coverage in circa 1993 to include the voices of Muslim Americans, during which the program was briefly known as "Arab Voices, Crescent Rising".

Radio Tahrir ultimately sought to highlight Arab and Muslim community members' lived experiences, accomplishments, and challenges, particularly as it related to Islamophobia and civil rights. Radio Tahrir typically aired every week on Tuesdays or Saturdays in 30 or 60 minute episodes. These episodes featured a variety of content, including interviews and discussions with invited guests. In addition to its regular programming, Radio Tahrir also produced documentaries; specials, particularly during the month of Ramadan; and series, such as "Maqam: From Cordoba to Baghdad" (circa 1997), "6 Arab American Poets" (1997), and "Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon" (2004-2006). The program broadcasted regularly until April 13, 2013.

Radio Tahrir was led by Dr. Aziz, who served as the program's executive director. She also served as host, co-host, or producer. She was supported by dozens of Arab and Muslim volunteers and interns over the years, including Hassen Abdella, Jad Abumrad, Aisha Al-Adawiya, Mona Al-Dahry, Fatima Ashraf, Saadia Aslam, Anisa Bouzianne, Ibrahim Gonzalez, Dave Hall, Nazik Hibatfa, Hussein Ibish, Mahmoud Ibrahim, Mona Iskander, Tamara Issak, Ryme Katkhouda, Dean Obeidallah, Sarah Malaika, Nadja Middleton, Reem Nasr, Sally Sherif, and Maysoon Zayid. Dr. Aziz recruited these volunteers and interns because she viewed Radio Tahrir as a space where Arab and Muslim community members could voice their concerns as well as become more deeply engaged with the public sphere and radio journalism. Many Radio Tahrir volunteer producers were also Muslim women whose positionality offered unique opportunities to address issues like discrimination in mosques and Muslim children's educational needs.

In addition to her work at Radio Tahrir, Dr. Aziz supported WBAI Radio and the Pacifica Network in other ways. She traveled throughout the Middle East, interviewing and providing reports for use in their programs as well as Radio Tahrir. She also spent a significant amount of time in Iraq documenting the impact of the United Nations sanctions in that country in the years following the Invasion of Kuwait. She also hosted the WBAI Radio current affairs program Behind the News from 2000-2002, and participated in other WBAI and non-WBAI programs, including Labbrish, The Morning Show, and TalkBack.

As a result of her work at Radio Tahrir, Dr. Aziz founded the Radius of Arab American Writers Inc. (RAWI) in 1993. RAWI is a national literary and networking organization focused on supporting Arab American writers. She served as RAWI's director until about 2005. Her other professional activities included spending a year (2007-2008) at Algeria's University of Oran as a Fulbright Scholar as well as working and teaching in Syria (from 2009-2012).

Dr. Aziz has published numerous books over the years, including Heir to a Silent Song: Two Rebel Women of Nepal (2001), Swimming up the Tigris: Real Life Encounters with Iraq (2007), Short Features for Radio: A Manual for Broadcast Journalists (2011), and Yogmaya & Durga Devi: Rebel Women of Nepal (2020). She has contributed to several blogs and websites, including CounterPunch, her personal website's blog, and the Radio Tahrir blog.
Dr. Barbara Nimri Aziz currently resides in New York.

scopecontent.p: The Barbara Aziz broadcasts collection (868 digital audio files (online) and 0.1 linear feet) document Dr. Barbara Nimri Aziz's journalistic career, particularly as it pertained to WBAI Radio's Radio Tahrir, Behind the News, and TalkBack programs. Collection material is dated from 1988-2014 and includes broadcast episodes and episode segments, commentaries, documentaries, interviews, news reports, and recitations.

There is some overlap between the Radio Tahrir and related material series as well as the Interviews and related material series. Researchers are encouraged to consult both series for relevant material.

scopecontent.p: The Radio Tahrir and related material series (648 digital audio files (online) and 0.1 linear feet) consists primarily of episodes, episode segments, and unique series associated with the radio magazine, Radio Tahrir.

Radio Tahrir episodes typically consisted of multiple kinds of content, including commentaries from experts as well as listening audience members, interviews with guests, literary readings and recitations, reports, and/or testimonials. Guests on the program included activists, attorneys, authors, artists, religious and secular community leaders, filmmakers, journalists, musicians, poets, and scholars. Although a wide range of cultural, historical, literary, political, and religious topics relating to different Arabic and/or Muslim communities around the world were discussed on the program, those relating to Iraq, Israel, and Palestine are prominently featured.

Also included are several special series associated with Radio Tahrir. The most prominent of these series included are "Maqam: From Cordoba to Baghdad" (circa 1997), which focused on Arabic music and featured Simon Shaheen; "6 Arab American Poets" (1997); and "Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon" (2004-2006), which was co-hosted by Arab American comedians Dean Obeidallah and Maysoon Zayid.
Other material in this series are several National Alliance of Third World Journalists' Alliance Report episodes as well as physical "6 Arab American Poets" brochures.

did.abstract: (Alliance Radio Report Special)

(Interview with Ghaleb Halasa, studio discussion of modern Arab literature. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: novelist Ghaleb Halasa (Syria); NY poet Layla Jamal; Prof Pierre Kahiyah. Topics: Arab literature, Arab poetry, Middle East, Palestine.)

(Damascus-based author Ghaleb Halasa, continuing with studio guests Layla Jamal and Pierre Kahiya. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Novelist Damascus based Ghaleb Halasa (Syria), NY poet Layla Jamal, Prof Pierre Kahiyah. Topics: Arab literature, Arab poetry, Middle East, Palestine.)

(Sout Al-Chab radio program, in Arabic, mother broadcasts to son in prison. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Mona Atway, radio producer, Sout Al-Chab Radio, Beirut. Topics: media, Lebanon, prisoners, Middle East.)

(Kamāl Abū Dīb, who talks about his work and modern literary issues, pan-Arab themes, historical and contemporary, in Damascus. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Kamal Abu Deeb, well known Syrian novelist. Topics: Syria, Arab literature.)

(Interview of American translator and storyteller Inea Bushnaq. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Inea Bushnaq, NY-based Storyteller/translator. Topics: Palestine, Culture, Folktales.)

(Images of Arab women in literature and media. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Nadia Hijab, author of "Women Power: Women and Work in the Middle East." Topics: Arab women, Middle East, economy, development.)

(Mikael on 1920 history and Sharaawi's role in Egypt's women's movement. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Mona Mikael, author and professor of Arabic, NYU, NY. Topics: Arab women, Egypt, Middle East, Huda Sharaawi.)

(Boutros recalls his early study of music in Palestine, being a musician. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Peter Boutros, NY-based musician. Topics: Arab music, oud performance, Palestine.)

(Palestinian resistance leader Intissar Wazir speaks about her work. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Intissar Wazir, Palestinian resistance leader. Topics: Palestine, leadership, independence struggle.)

(Baqsami speaks about her work, art, exhibitions and gallery. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Thoraya Al-Baqsami, Kuwaiti artist. Topics: Kuwait, art, women, invasion, Iraq.)

(German Arab scholar Birgette Seekemp discusses Arab literature and Palestinian novel, interviewed in Damascus, Syria. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Birgette Seekemp, German scholar of Arabic in Syria. Topics: Arab literature, Syria, Palestine.)

(Aziz interviews writer and editor Daoud Talhami (Damascus-based, Palestinian editor, journalist) in Damascus, Syria. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Daoud Talhami, Damascus-based, Palestinian editor, journalist. Topics: Middle East, Palestine, publishing.)

(Zahaby speaks about life as a writer, influences from US, limits in Syria. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Khairy Al Zahaby, Syrian author, Damascus-based. Topics: Arab literature, Syria.)

(Discusses 1970s Iraq economic policy, professional class, new UN US sanctions, economy. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Rashid Yakoub, Iraqi economist, engineer, US-based. Topics: Iraq, economic history, economy, sanctions.)

(Baqsami speaks about her writing and women's struggle for rights. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Thoraya Al-Baqsami, Kuwaiti artist, recorded in Kuwait. Topics: Kuwait, art, literature, women, recorded in Kuwait.)

(Aziz reflects on those she met in Iraq, during these weeks while bombing is underway, recorded segments of Aziz report in Nasiriya (South Iraq). Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Barbara Nimri Aziz producer, Iraq correspondent, NY-based Mary Kadi reading. Topics: Iraq, Gulf War, anti-war, war, US policies, journalism.)

(Aziz interviews Mai Masri and Jean Chamoun about filmmaking in Lebanon, in NY. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Mai Masri and Jean Chamoun, Beirut-based filmmakers. Topics: Lebanon, film, Middle East, Arab women.)

(Syed Mohammad Syeed (Sayyid Syeed) comments on anti-Muslim bias and how to counter it. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Sayeed Sayed, PA-based community leader, scholar. Topics: American Muslims, leadership, media.)

(Aziz commentary regarding Israeli bombings on South Lebanon, program honoring martyr Anwar Yassin, resistance to occupation, vocals by Ferouz. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Producers at Sout Al-Chab Radio, Beirut. Topics: Lebanon, prisoners, occupation resistance.)

(Barbara Nimri Aziz (BN Aziz) speaks from experiences as correspondent inside Iraq, also music. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: BN Aziz comments on Iraq. Topics: Iraq, UN bombing, sanctions.)

(Al-Radi reviews international archeological digs and finds in Iraq and current US bombing on Iraq, threat on ancient archeological sites, Iraqi universities. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Selma Al-Radi, Iraqi archeologist, NY-based. Topics: Iraq, sanctions, US current bombing policy, antiquities.)

(Aziz reflects on images in US press during bombing of Iraq and her first-hand experiences, open phones to listeners. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Barbara Nimri Aziz, producer, Iraq correspondent. Topics: Iraq, Gulf War, anti-war, images of Iraq in US books.)

(Aziz comments on US Muslim civil rights and takes listener calls, interviews filmmakers Mai Masri and Jean Chamoun. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Mai Masri and Jean Chamoun, Beirut-based filmmakers. Topics: US Civil rights, film, Middle East.)

(Kassem speaks about activist career; Hakmoun speaks about work and plays. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Casey Kassem radio producer, Hassan Hakmoun, musician. Topics: Arab America, civil rights activism, West African music.)

(Forzley reports on business exchanges and co-operation of American and Middle East Arabs, and discrimination, civil rights. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Michele Forzley, Boston-based businesswoman. Topics: Arab American community activism, business in Middle East.)

(Hajjar Ghani and her father describe being bombed by US allies for 42 days. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Hajjar Ghani, Iraqi student; Mohammed Ghani sculptor in Baghdad. Topics: Iraq, children, 1991 bombing (Gulf War).)

(Al-Radi testifies to her findings after 1991 US bombings on infrastructure, health and ancient treasures and monuments. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Selma Al-Radi, Iraqi archeologist, NY-based. Topics: Iraq, US bombing, sanctions, US policy, antiquities.)

(Ziad Abdul Samad, interviewed in Beirut about civil, humanitarian assistance during conflict interview. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Ziad Abdul Samad, engineer, development officer. Topics: Lebanon civil war, Secours Populaire relief organization.)

(Open phones for listener comments on Ramadan, Iraq, and sanctions. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Baghdad-based writer and critic Jabra Ibrahim Jabra, Iraq sanctions, media. Topics: Ramadan, Islam, Iraq, UN sanctions effects, callins (badly distorted).)
(A visit to Sout Al-Shab radio, Beirut, on war resistance. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Various testimonials. Topics: Lebanon, Media.)

(Jabril speaks about work in Kuwait, result of war in Kuwait, political analysis; Renfrew reviews Salinger book "Secret Dossier". Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Palestinian refugee from Kuwait, Showki Jabril; Nita Renfrew NY-journalist. Topics: Kuwait, Iraq, Palestine, refugees, regional economy.)
(Special on Medical Issues in Iraq)

(Discusses 1970s Iraq economic policy, professional class, new UN sanctions, economy. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Iraqi doctors, Dr Hamid of Iraq Red Cross, Baghdad, Malaysian Dr Shaharom. Topics: Iraq, bombing, health conditions, Arab and Muslim medical assistance.)

(Ahmed Jabra reports on needs and assistance, Kerbala doctors report on bombing effects on health and medical conditions, Dr. Al-Murshadi reports on destruction of medical centers by internal and external attacks. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Iraqi doctors, NY-based Dr Amed Jabra, Kerbala Dr Naffi, Dr Kudaiyar Al-Murshadi, Kerbala. Topics: Iraq, sanctions, medical deterioration.)

(Water in Middle East special. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Egyptian engineer Mohammed O. Galal; geologist in West Bank Al-Ashri: US based historian Munir Farah. Topics: Egypt, Syria, water resources, Middle East.)

(Aziz interviews Dr. Buthaina Shaabana, author of "Right Hand Left Hand", in Damascus, Syria. Hosts/Producer: Barbara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Buthaina Shaaban, Damascus-based writer, Professor of English, translator. Topics: Arabic literature, Middle East.)

(Reports on women in Palestinian resistance, gains and losses, Arab women and their relation to western women, efforts in media and academia. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Suha Sabagh, Arab Women's Studies Center, director, DC. Topics: women, Palestine, peaceful resistance, Middle East, media.)

(Each guest describes the work of their committee in the USA, to build solidarity and educate Americans. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Arab America Institute director, Helen Samhan, Palestine Solidarity Committee, Riyad Khourey; AAUG director Ghada Talhami. Topics: Arab American community activism in US, elections, Palestine solidarity, Arab American University Graduate Association work in USA.)

(Alliance Report: Al-Radi testifies to her findings after 1991 US bombings on infrastructure, and doctors report on breakdown of health conditions and facilities. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Selma Al-Radi, archeologist, NY-based, Kerbala Hosp doctors. Topics: Iraq, sanctions, health facilities.)
(Thoraya Al-Baqsami interview)
(Episode on water and the Golan, featuring Undercurrents reports)

(Interview in Arabic about Munir Bashir's work with selections; translated by Mary K. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Munir Bashir, Iraqi composer and virtuoso. Topics: Iraq, Music, Munir Bashir.)

(Aziz elaborates on restrictions on sanctioned US diplomats, listeners' calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Iraq, US restrictions on diplomats. Topics: Iraq, sanctions, US policy, United Nations.)

(Aziz interviews Washington, DC-based author of "Fields of Fig and Olive," Kathryn Abdul Baki. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Kathryn Abdul Baki, Washington-based author. Topics: Arab American literature, Palestine.)

(Akram Zatari interviews Moufida Tlatli, Tunisian director of "Silences of the Palace"; translated by Jacqueline Hazzi (English and French). Hosts/Producer: Akram Zatari. Interviewees/Guests: Moufida Tlatli, Tunisian director of "Silences of the Palace". Topics: film, Tunisia.)
(Alliance Report and "Radio Tahrir" joint episode)

(Musloom talks about radio voice of the Arab community and changes in political atmosphere. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Richard Musloom, WFUV (NY) radio host. Topics: Arab American, activism, media.)

(Nibari speaks from Kuwait, on upcoming election; PHR Geiger's and Kirshner's presentations to conference on deaths of Palestinian prisoner. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Abdallah Nibari, Kuwaiti MP; Drs J Gieger and R Kirshner, Physicians for Human Rights (PHR). Topics: Kuwait, democracy, Palestine, prisoners, Human Rights.)

(Aziz interviews women (Edith Koniky, Meena Alexander, Barbara E Smith, Claire Coss) celebrating Women's History Month. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: American writers Edith Koniky, Meena Alexander, Barbara E Smith (Feminist Press), Claire Coss. Topics: world literature, Women.)
(Aziz interviews poet DH Melhem about her work, with readings. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: DH Melhem, NY-based poet. Topics: Arab American literature, poetry.)

(Announcements, testimony by grieving aunt (in Arabic); interview with Palestinian leader about resistance and intifadah; Ramon Salah reading names of new Palestinian martyrs. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Palestinian aunt of martyred boy Omar Sabah, West bank; Um Jihad Intissar Al-Wazir, director, Palestine Human Rights Info Center Chicago list of dead and wounded. Topics: Muslim Eid Al-Fitr, Palestine, human rights, resistance to occupation.)

(Aziz interviews Mahmoud Shaheen about his work, Damascus, Syria. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Mahmoud Shaheen, Damascus-based Palestinian writer. Topics: Arabic literature, Middle East, Palestine.)

(Kashmiri records violence against Canadians in wake of US bombing of Iraq, Abed reports on attacks and harassment against Arabs in schools in US. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Canadian journalist Zuheir Kashmiri, author of "The Gulf Within"; NY-based community rep. Essa Abed. Topics: Iraq, war, human rights, media, racism, Canada, anti-Arab acts in USA.)

(90 minute special 2 years after invasion of Kuwait, report on Iraq economic and health conditions, Aziz summary of changes and democracy movement in Kuwait, Nita Renfrew reviews Iraq-Kuwait history from 1890s, Dilip Hiro on British-Kuwait history. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Fellowship of Reconciliation (FOR) Doug Hostedder, authors Dilip Hiro and Nita Renfrew, Iraq Kerbala Hospital doctors. Topics: Iraq, Kuwait, invasion of Kuwait, sanctions, medical conditions.)
(Report on Palestinians held by Israel, activism, Palestinian hunger strike, statistics on Palestinian prisoners)

(Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Palestinian Human rights worker Nasser Bargouti, director Ahmed Sayed, Ramallah-based Mandela Institute for Prisoners. Topics: Palestine, Israel, political prisoners, human rights, intifadah.)

(Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: continuation of part 1, with Ahmed Sayed (Mandela Institute), extensive Aziz commentary. Topics: Palestine, Israel, political prisoners, human rights, intifadah.)

(Aziz Interviews Sudanese author Tayeb Saleh; Syrian writer Buthaina Shaaban. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Tayeb Saleh, Buthaina Shaaban. Topics: Arab Literature, Sudan, Syria.)

(Aziz Interviews translator and storyteller Inea Bushnaq on Ramadan culture. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Inea Bushnaq, Storyteller. Topics: Ramadan, religion, Muslim culture.)

(Salloum talks about making the film "Up To The South". Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Dave Hall. Interviewees/Guests: multi-media Canadian filmmaker Jayce Salloum. Topics: Lebanon, Israeli occupation, resistance, prisoners.)

(Tarif comments on media bias and effects on accusations in US bombings, announcements, Dr Al-Saadawi comments on US media bias and anti-Muslim rhetoric. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NY-based attorney Tarif Warren, Egyptian author Nawal El-Saadawi; author Nita Renfrew. Topics: NY-1993 bombing, civil rights, Islam, US media.)

(Taher reports on Ramadan in Jordan and history; Ammar on her collection of Arab Women's writing; Aziz reads from book by L. Abu Lughod; announcements. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Jordan based Hiam Taher on Ramadan; Kansas-based editor Marti Ammar. Topics: Ramadan, Jordan, Islam, Literature, women writers, book review.)

(Poet and author Joseph discusses his family history and writing career. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NY-based poet Lawrence Joseph. Topics: Arab American literature, poetry.)

(Aziz interviews visiting Sudan author Tayeb Saleh and Iran-US artist Samiramis Ziyeh. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Tayeb Saleh, author of "Season of Migration to the North". Topics: Sudan, Arabic literature.)

(Aziz interviews poet Haas Mroue on his book "Beirut Seizures," published in CA. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Haas Mroue, Paris and Colorado-based poet from Lebanon. Topics: poetry, Arab American literature.)
(Interview with Dr. Naffi, with commentary by Barbara Nimri Aziz)

(Aziz Interviews author, poet Mohja Kahf. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Mohja Kahf, Poet, Professor of English, University of Arkansas. Topics: Arab American Literature, Poetry.)

(Reviews new publications on Islam in response to growing public policy, educational needs, and public interest in the subject. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Barbara Nimri Aziz, host. Topics: Islam, book reviews.)

(Guests comment on Arabs in election and Arab dialogue in NJ and NY city administrations. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NJ-based observer publisher Seif Ashmawi, NY-based activist and social worker Essa Abed. Topics: US elections, Arab American community.)

(Aziz comments on books for and about children, children's songs, with listeners calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: N/A. Topics: Thanksgiving commentary, children's books, announcements, commentary.)

(Discussion of Edward Said\'s November 1993 essay "The Phony Islamic Threat", NYT Magazine. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Ryme Katkhouda, Mohammed B Hamid, Hussein Ibish. Topics: Islam.)

(Joseph on his book "Common Sense"; Dr. Alawi in a recorded presentation and interview on Arab women in leadership. Hosts/Producer: Dave Hall. Interviewees/Guests: NY-based science author Larry E. Joseph, Dr. Asia Ben Sala Alawi of Morocco. Topics: literature, science writing, journalism, Arab women.)

(Aziz interviews DH Melhem and Ron David regarding being writers of Arab heritage in the US. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: DH Melhem, NY-based poet, Ron David, NJ based author. Topics: Arab American literature, poetry.)

(Al-Radi discusses Yemen and reconstruction of historical structures in Yemen. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Selma Al-Radi, Iraqi archeologist, NY-based. Topics: Yemen, Archeology.)

(Dave Williams' reads poem introducing discussion, a review of stats regarding Arabs in US, and reports by Kayal and Naff and Smithsonian collection. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Dave Hall. Interviewees/Guests: immigration Arab-American historians Drs. Phil Kayal, author and Smithsonian curator Alexa Naff. Topics: Arab American history, immigration, poetry.)

(Kadri documents history of Cairo as a major city in the region. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Kadri Al-Arabi, NY-based Egyptian historian. Topics: Egypt, Cairo, Middle East history.)

(Pacifica news report from Jerusalem (6 minutes), followed by Aziz commentary and listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Barbara Nimri Aziz, correspondent in Jerusalem. Topics: Palestine, Israeli policies of home expropriations.)

(Aziz Interviews Arab American poet Khaled Mattawa, who reads from his new book "Ismalia Eclipse" and speaks about his work. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Khaled Mattawa, poet, professor of literature, University of Michigan. Topics: Arab American literature, poetry.)

(Aziz interviews Ms. Rauia Abdel Azem in Cairo; translation from Arabic by Jaqueline Hazzi. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Rauia Abdul Azem, Cairo-based publisher of Sin'a. Topics: Arabic literature, Middle East publishing.)
(Interview with London-based vocalist Najma Aktar on modern Gazal-style)

(Discussion of upcoming exhibition of Arab Women's Art in Washington, DC. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Ryme Katkhouda. Interviewees/Guests: Samia Halaby, NY-based visual artist. Topics: art, Palestine, Middle East, Arab women.)

(Professor Zoulaika (interviewed in Algeria) speaks about economic failures and civil strife in Algeria, Aziz draws on recent visit to Algeria to elaborate; Arjoush speaks about her current exhibition in NY and her photography techniques. Topics: Algeria, art, Saudi Arabia, Arab identity and Islam.)

Interviewees/Guests: UK journalist/author Dilip Hiro; Prof. Michael Hudson, Georgetown University, DC:. Topics: Yemen, Middle East, US policy.)

did.abstract: (David Williams talks about his work and reads his poems. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Topics: Arab American literature, poetry.)

did.abstract: (Bouziane's interview with director Chahine, NY exhibit of photographer Yasmine Bouziane; Hussein Ibish review Iraq response to US-UN inspections. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: intern Ryme Katkhouda, film critic Anissa Bouziane; political observer Hussein Ibish. Topics: Egyptian filmmaker Yusuf Chahine; Iraq, US policy on Iraq, sanctions.)

(Abu Sabe reviews Arab role in NJ elections, Ryme Katkhouda's radio profile of Palestinian village of Deir Yassin; Hussein Ibish comments on UN inspections leaving Iraq. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Murad Abu Sabe, NJ-based observer, Ryme Katkhouda, Amherst-based political commentator Hussein Ibish. Topics: state elections, Palestine, Deir Yassin village, UN sanctions on Iraq and its policy on UN inspections.)

(Sheik Al-Khalidin describes community outreach and education; Ibish comments on US and Russian policies regarding Iraq. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NY-based Muslim Sheik al-Khaladin, Hussein Ibish. Topics: police brutality, civil rights, anti-Islam racism, Muslim Americans, Iraq and US policy.)

(Our US Thanksgiving Day program "Taking the Land" explores parallels between Palestinians and Native American experience. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Native American activist/producer Raven Silva, Palestinian editor/economist Adel Samara. Topics: Native American history, Palestine history, land loss.)

(Ibish reports on OIC conference in Tehran; Lisa Mohammed reads her new work, and Bouziane reviews North African films in NY-African Diaspora Film Festival. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: poet Lisa Mohammed, film-reviewer Anissa Bouziane, Hussein Ibish. Topics: Organization of Islam Conference, poetry, French-Algerian films.)

(Ibish comments on Jordanian political tensions and Jordan-Iraq strained relations; Awadallah reports on wider observance of Muslim holidays; part 2 of interview with Farid Esack edited by Mona Al-Dahry; Gonzalez's Ramadan music production. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: political observer Hussein Ibish, South African Muslim leader/author Farid Esack, NJ-Community rep Prof Hani Awadallah; sufi musician Ibrahim Gonzalez. Topics: Jordan, election, Middle East, Iraq-Jordanian relations, Ramadan, Islam, sufi poetry.)

(MT Mehdi reports on Ramadan public education, Gonzalez's music-poetic Sufi production, poems by Abdul Hayy Moore who also talks about Ramadan. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: film critic Anissa Bouziane, community leader MT Mehdi, Sufi musician Ibrahim Gonzalez, poet Abdul Hayy Moore. Topics: Ramadan, Muslim Americans.)

(Bouziane describes her current exhibit, satirizing colonial art postcards; Poets Kaldas and Moosey read their work, Al-Radi on Uzbekistan. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: photographer Yasmine Bouziane, poets Pauline Kaldas and Brenda Moosey. Topics: Arab American poetry and art, photography, women.)

(Wolfe speaks on his Hajj experience and his film on the subject. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Michael Wolf, American Muslim author, filmmaker. Topics: Islam, Hajj pilgrimage, film.)

(Clips of Mehdi speaking on Radio Tahrir and testimonials from his funeral. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: MT Mehdi, NY-based Civil rights leader, media spokesman. Topics: Arab, Muslim, Muslim Americans, civil rights.)

(Saad comments on rise of airline profiling of Arabs, Muslims with examples; Bouziane reviews, comments on current Egyptian film festival in NY, Flanders comment on possible US attack on Iraq; Gonzalez's "Readings from the Heart". Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: civil rights attorney Houeida Saad, film critic Anissa Bouziane, sufi musician Ibrahim Gonzalez. Topics: airline profiling of Muslims/Arabs, film reviews, Egyptian films, Iraq, US policy, sufi creation.)

(Suleiman comments on nature, and significance of the 8th Organization of Islamic Conference in Iran; Ibish comments on weakening US policy to isolate Iraq; listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: political observer Hussein Ibish political commentator, Beirut-based journalist Sultan Suleiman. Topics: Iraq, Middle East, Iran, Organization of Islamic Conference in Tehran.)

(Lamea Abbas Amara, Aseel Dyke and host Aziz describe conditions, facts and feelings after 8 years of sanctions and threat of invasion; Anisa Mehdi remembers her rights activist father MT Mehdi. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: poets DH Melhem, Lamea Abbas Amara, Oregon community leader Aseel Dyke, NJ-based filmmaker Anisa Mehdi. Topics: poetry, Iraq, sanctions, anti-war and anti-sanctions actions, civil rights.)

(Assaghier reports Algeria's political instability, and torture and terror; Melhem reads poetry and speaks about her work. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: M Assaghier, NJ-based Algerian political observer; NY poet DH Melhem. Topics: Algeria, politics, civil war, civil rights, Arab American literature, poetry.)

(Celebrating women on International Women's Day; Amal Awad with Hudson country anti-alcohol services; students Samara and Aisha Khan and Awad talk about accomplishments and struggle as Muslims. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: four NY-NJ Arab Muslim women: Jonie Moosey, Amal Awad, Aisha Khan, Samara Khan. Topics: Muslim Americans, women.)

(Aziz comments on political developments in Jordan; AbuBakr reports on recent YariYari African women's conf and writing project for women. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NY-poet Rashida AbuBakr. Topics: women, poetry, anti-war, Jordan.)

(Aziz interview with Nahida Djani in Washington, and Nawal El-Saadawi discussing women and social issues. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Nahida Djani, Jerusalem-based journalist; author, Nawal El-Saadawi. Topics: Palestine, journalist, literature, Egypt.)

(Harris explains and clarifies distinguishing aspects of Sufi Islam, methodology. Hosts/Producer: Mahmoud Ibrahim. Interviewees/Guests: Rabia Harris, author, translator 'Sufi Book of Spiritual Ascent'. Topics: Islam, spiritual music, Sufi.)

(Ibish reports on political crackdown and democracy in Jordan and evolving nature of opposition, and emerging Saudi-Iran rapprochement; al-Mutawa speaks about his children's book, Dukhan speaks about Arab writing and his training as a calligrapher. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: political observer Hussein Ibish, author Naif Al-Mutawa, calligrapher Nihad Dukhan. Topics: Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Iran political rights, opposition leader Leith Speilat, Kuwait writer/psychologist Al-Mutawa, Arabic calligraphy.)

(Aziz's community announcements; Naif al-Mutawa on writing children's book, and comments on cultural identities. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Naif al-Mutawa, Kuwait-based psychologist, author, activist. Topics: literature, culture, Middle East, Kuwait.)

(Jabara explains US government use of secret evidence, attempts to overturn it, and appeal for public support; Ibish reviews Israeli occupation in Lebanon; and possible policy changes, Lebanon and Syria relations, documentary on Lebanon resistance. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NY-attorney Abdeen Jabara, commentator Hussein Ibish. Topics: secret evidence, civil rights, Lebanon, Israeli policy, Syria.)

(Host Lomax reviews history of Malcolm, interviews guests describe experience with Islam and introduce the book "Neophytes Guide to Spiritual Islam", with audio clips of Malcolm X, Malcolm's legacy of justice, and international movement. Hosts/Producer: Dayiia Lomax. Interviewees/Guests: Malcolm X Special: activists Ngiamo and Onaji Muid; NY Professor Small of Muslim mosque of America. Topics: Malcolm X, African American Muslim.)

(Ibish comments on changing Iran-US relations, Aziz on Middle East experience, and Arab view of US, Bouziane interviews filmmaker Fatima Jebli Quazzami's film "In My Father's House". Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: political commentator Hussein Ibish, film critic Anissa Bouziane with Moroccan filmmaker Fatima Jebli Quazzami. Topics: Iran, US policy, media, film festival, women.)

(Al-Mukthar updates US sanctions in regards to Iraqi international exchanges, Martinez describes activities at Baghdad embassy to promote cultural life, Vander Cruz describes tours to Iraq to promote exchanges, Aziz news report from Jerusalem on Israeli takeover of Palestinian homes, listener callings. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Iraqi researcher Salah Al-Mukthar, Jerard Martinez, French cultural attache in Baghdad, Chantel Vander Cruz, Belgian anti-embargo activist for exchange with Iraq. Topics: Iraq, UN sanctions, US policy, diplomacy, anti-sanctions actions, art, cultural exchange, Jerusalem, Israeli occupation.)

(Moughrabi talks about his edited collection "Open Veins of Jerusalem", and comments on ongoing Israeli house occupations and settlements, listener calls, al-Mufti interviewed in Baghdad; reports on Ibn Kaldoun anti-sanctions ship stopped by US troops. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: University of Tennessee Prof Fouad Moughrabi, ed. of "The Open Veins of Jerusalem", Iraqi journalist Nermin al-Mufti. Topics: Jerusalem, Israeli occupations and settlement growth, Muslim American, women, Iraq, anti-action sanctions.)

(Ibish reports and comments on increased France-Syria relations and regional implications, "Guava Shakti" editors describe their new women\'s literary zine. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: political observer Hussein Ibish, NY student editors Zohra Saed, Habiba Ibrahim and Daniella Elliot. Topics: Algeria, France football star Zeidan, Syria, France relations, Hafiz A-Assad in France, Asian American literature.)

(Arkansas-Arab American poet Moosey discusses poetry slaming with Arab American author David; poet Jessica Moore, clips from film "Slam Nation". Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz (co-host). Interviewees/Guests: author Ron David, Poet Brenda Moosey. Topics: Arab American literature, American poetry.)

(Chechen historian Baeno discusses his book on Chechen history and Muslim identity, and early 20th century Russian purges. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Nadja Middleton. Interviewees/Guests: Jordan-based Chechen historian Saed Baeno. Topics: Chechnya, Jordanian Chechens.)

(Salloum reviews his dictionary of Arab words in English; Imam Talib discusses efforts to plan a city march and Muslim-Christian interfaith efforts. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Canadian author and researcher Habeeb Salloum; NY Muslim leader Imam Talib. Topics: Arabic language, Middle East, Muslim Americans.)

(Ibish comments on tense Afghan-Iran relations and relation to Russia, Saudi Arabia and USA, poem in memorial to Iraq Amariya bomb shelter victims. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: political observer Hussein Ibish. Topics: Afghanistan, Taliban, Iran, world music.)

(Mohammed reviews 800 years of US history in the USA, listener calls, Ibish comments on breakdown of Oslo Accord. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: DC-based historian Amir Mohammed, political observer Hussein Ibish. Topics: Muslim Americans, US Muslim history, Palestine.)

(A collection of MT Mehdi's statements; testimonials at his death and funeral in NY. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: MT Mehdi, NY-based civil rights leader and supporters. Topics: American Muslims, leadership.)

(Ibish comments on purported strained US-Israel relations and intra-Kurdish politics, Sarud comments on Iraqi Kurds and Kurdistan, Gonzalez Sufi production of poetry and music. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: political observer Hussein Ibish, Iraqi Kurdish US commentator Najib Sarud, sufi musician Ibrahim Gonzalez. Topics: US-Israel relations, arms sales, Middle East, Israeli occupation, Turkey, Iraq Kurds, Islam.)

(Aziz updates US-UN policy on Iraq including withdrawal of UN weapons teams and general socio-economic conditions under threat of US military attack, with extensive comment by Ibish and Naser Aruri, Flanders also comments on media bias regarding Iraq, listener callins. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Iraq 90 min special, BN Aziz correspondent in Iraq, political observer Hussein Ibish, NY journalist Laura Flanders, Dartmouth University Prof. Naser (Nasir) Aruri. Topics: Iraq, UN sanctions, UNSCOM team, US policy, Middle East, Palestine.)

(Attorney reviews case of client Hani Khairidin, fighting government use of secret evidence, testimony of case details by brother of Khairidin, and legal overview on secret evidence by Professor David Cole, testimony by Abdul K Ashkar. Hosts/Producer: Hassen Abdellah, Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: civil rights attorney Regis Fernandez, civil rights attorney Georgetown University Prof David Cole, defiant citizen Dr. Abdul Halim Ashkar. Topics: secret evidence, Muslim Americans, civil rights.)

(Iraq: How Can I Forget" audio documentary, educator and teacher workshop leader Shabbas offers example from her workbook, Hayy reads poems and discusses Islam in US with Aziz. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: bad audio quality, Iraq documentary, educator Audrey Shabbas (AWAIR-Arab World Islamic Resources); poet Abdul Hayy Moore (clearer sound). Topics: Iraq (bad Quality), education, Islam, poetry, Islam, Ramadam.)

(Hussein Ibish offers Ramadan recipe; Gonzalez interviews Feisel Rauf on his book and to explain Ramadan fasting and takes listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NY Muslim Imam Feisel Rauf, political observer Hussein Ibish, sufi musician Ibrahim Gonzalez. Topics: Islam, Ramadan, Feisel Rauf author of "Islam Search for Meaning".)

(Adeem comments and criticizes on Clash of Civilization theory, CHAIR representative describes Noruz festival and reports on aid for Iranian refugees; Ibish reviews Saudi history and political leadership, Samara comments on PA bureaucracy. Hosts/Producer: Mahmoud Ibrahim, Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Professor Ibad Adeem of DC's Minaret of Freedom Institute, member of CHAIR committee; political observer Hussein Ibish, Ramallah based economist Adel Samara. Topics: Clash of Civilizations theory, world history, Islamic history, Noruz festival, Iran refugees; Saudi Arabia, Palestine bureaucracy.)

(Starts with listener calls from part 1 (?), Ahmed reports on anti-sanctions public actions, Abdellah comments on US anti-terror measures, listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NJ resident Sapphire Ahmed, NJ Attorney Hassen Abdellah. Topics: Iraq, sanctions, United Nations corruption, US policy on Iraq, Islam in America, US anti-terror actions and media.)

(Ammash reports on research on the pollution created by UN-US sanctions, health issues. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Huda Ammash, Prof of Biology, Dean at Baghdad University. Topics: Iraq, sanctions, health issues.)

(Fawal is author of historical novel "On the Hills of God" and speaks about his work and life, Canada scholar Mona Salloum talks about her love of Arabic language. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: author Ibrahim Fawal, Canadian Arab language scholar Mona Salloum. Topics: Palestine, Arab American literature, Arabic language history and influences.)

(End of Aziz's report live from Jerusalem on conditions, personal testimonial of Palestine home demolitions by Israeli authorities, comment by Halpern. Hosts/Producer: Hussein Ibish. Interviewees/Guests: Aziz live reports from Jerusalem, Palestine resident Salim Shawarmi and Israeli journalist Jeff Halpern. Topics: Israeli occupation, Palestine, Palestinian economy, demolitions of Palestinian homes.)

(Aziz 1991 archival production on Iraq, recorded Alternative Radio 1999 lecture by Denis Halliday. Hosts/Producer: Jad Abumrad. Interviewees/Guests: retired UN official Denis Halliday, Aziz report on Iraq with Mary Kadi. Topics: Iraq, sanctions, poetry.)

(Testimonials by American Muslims about their embracing Islam produced by Nadja Middleton, report on NY-funeral of Amadou Diallo by Gonzalez. Hosts/Producer: Mahmoud Ibrahim, Ibrahim Gonzalez. Interviewees/Guests: NY-area American Muslims including Aisha Adawiya and Rashida Abdul Hakim, Ibrahim Gonzalez. Topics: African American Muslims, Islam, murder of Amadou Diallo, NY Muslim.)

(Ibish comments on recent Iran municipal elections and political dynamics, and visit of Khatemi to Italy and critiques US policy; Palestinian vocal. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: political observer Hussein Ibish. Topics: Iran, Iranian vocalist Sima Bina, Iranian elections.)

(Molecular biologist Ammash interviewed (part 2) re: toxic and health affects of breakdown of health and environment due to sanctions(2nd of 2 parts); part 2 with Ammash's research into effects of Iraq environment degradation (pt1). Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Iraqi professor U. Baghdad biologist and dean, Dr Huda Ammash (in English). Topics: Iraq, UN sanctions, environment, Arab women, anti-Iraq war, depleted uranium.)

(Guests (Afghan American) discuss Afghan women under Taliban and earlier history (pre-1979), report on petition in support of Afghan women. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Four Afghan women guests, Zohra Y. Daoud, Laila Z. Helms, Halima Malikyar, and Zahera Saed. Topics: Afghanistan, Afghan women, rights.)

(Aziz remembers WBAI program director, supporter of Radio Tahrir program, Ibish reviews current Palestinian student elections and progress to implement Interim Oslo Accord, Abumrad reviews David Hare's theater "Via Della Rosa", Middleton reviews NY-Festival of Senegalese films. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: political observer Hussein Ibish, interns A. Bishara and Jad Abumrad theater reviewer, reviewer Nadja Middleton. Topics: memorial for WBAI program director, Palestine, Oslo Accord, Palestine-Israeli relations, theater review, Senegal film.)

(Aziz interviews Iraqi Artist Mediha Umar in NY; visits NY Exhibition of Iraqi Architect Zaha Hadid. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Mediha Umar, Artist; Zaha Hadid, Architect. Topics: Iraq, Art, Architecture.)

(Salloum reviews Arab influences on Andalusian Spanish culture and origin of cook books; poem by A. Bishara, recipes by staff members. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Jad Abumrad. Interviewees/Guests: author Habeeb Salloum, interns Amal Bishara and Nadja Middleton. Topics: Arab food, Arab culture and Andalusia, poetry.)

(Mai Faraj reading Kanafani novel (in Arabic), Jayyusi comments on Kanafani's literary achievements and politics; Naqib, friend of Kanafani recalls his life, announcement of Tahrir webpage by Jad Abumrad; Kerbala doctors medical report. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Arab literature scholar and translator Dr Salma Jayyusi; Prof Fadl Naqib (University of Waterloo, Canada); Kerbala doctors. Topics: Palestinian novelist Ghassan Kanafani, Arabic literature, Iraq, sanctions, medical.)
(Special on Jerusalem)
(Aziz interviews Mohja Kahf in NY. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Mohja Kahf, Poet, Professor of English, University of Arkansas. Topics: poetry, Arab American literature.)

(Murphy reports on anti-war actions, Kerbala doctor reports on medical shortages due to UN sanctions, Nahal (Baghdad interview) reports on relief to Iraq internal refugees, Hiro comments on Iraq sanctions regional policy. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Tony Murphy of Emergency Mobilization of IAC, ME Council of Churches representative in Iraq Michel Nahal, Iraqi doctors, London based journalist Dilip Hiro. Topics: Iraq, UN sanctions, health conditions, Iraq Relief, anti-war on Yugoslavia actions.)

(Imad Hamad reports on experience of US government 12-year harassment by secret evidence, Saalakhan reports on secret evidence case of Anwar Khadam. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Jad Abumrad, Detroit-based community leader Imad Hamad, Maurii Saalakhan, Dir. Peace and Justice Foundation, Kit Gage (NCPPF). Topics: new webpage, secret evidence, Muslim Americans, civil rights.)

(Gage updates regarding efforts to overturn government use of secret evidence in more than 20 US federal cases HR2121; Ibish reviews history policy and future of ADC Arab American Anti-Discrimination Committee, Qurashi describes work as experimental theater. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Kit Gage of National Coalition to Protect Political Freedoms (NCPPF), political observer Hussein Ibish, Theater director Ibrahim Qurashi. Topics: secret evidence, civil rights, Muslim Americans; Arab Americans, theater.)

(Al-Mubarak reports on Kuwait elections and women's rights, London-based Pakistani Aamer Hussein (edit by Mai Faraj and Jad Abumrad) author on South Asian Arab writers, reads from his "This Other Salt"; Hussein Ibish on Lebanon war. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: London-based author of "This Other Salt" Aamer Hussein, Kuwait Professor Masuma Al-Mubarak, political observer Hussein Ibish. Topics: Kuwait, democracy. Arab women, South Asian literature, media review, Israeli bombing Lebanon.)

(Ibish comments on US policies regarding Palestine and Kosovo; media critic AbuNima reviews media coverage of Palestinians, Aziz interview with poet Mohja Kahf. Hosts/Producer: Hussein Ibish. Interviewees/Guests: Nadja Middleton, media critic Ali AbuNima, poet and professor Mohja Kahf. Topics: Palestine, Kosovo, media review, Arab American literature.)
(Jad Abumrad news highlights and related materials)

(Aziz reads from Kostler's novel on Khazar and M Crichton's "Eaters of the Dead"; news update by Jad Abumrad. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Jad Abumrad. Interviewees/Guests: Aziz, reading passages of books on the Khazar people; production assistant Jad Abumrad. Topics: Khazar Empire history, 10th C. author Ibn Fadlan.)

(Ibish comments on US bombing of Sudan purported weapons factory, Sudan-Africa states relations; Karahan reports on Turkey with political, Jad Abumrad reports on January 1998 Ramadan interfaith at NY-St John Divine Cathedral and US anti-Muslim actions. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Jad Abumrad. Interviewees/Guests: political observer Hussein Ibish; Turkey observer Hurriyet Karahan; speakers from Interfaith Ramadan ifthar. Topics: Sudan, US military bombing, ramifications of earthquake in Turkey, Islam, Ramadan interfaith, Islam, civil rights.)

(Mirza describes goals and nature of magazine "Al-Talab"; Qurashi comments on media Muslim US images, and Muslim marginalization and use of theater. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: producer Jad Abumrad, Theater director Ibrahim Qurashi, UCLA magazine editor Sekina Mirza. Topics: Muslim American publishing, media bias, Muslim and Arab, political observer Hussein Ibish.)

(From 1993 archive, part 2 (instruments) of 5 part series of Arab music history. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: oud virtuoso and teacher musician Simon Shaheen. Topics: Arab music.)

(Abumrad's production from NY St John Divine Interfaith Ramadan, Middleton reports and voices from the NY Muslim Day Parade, Aisha Adawiya interviews sisters who assist Muslim women in need. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Jad Abumrad, Interfaith participants, Aisha Adawiya, Kairiah A. Latif, Muslim Day parade report by Nadja Middleton, Jordan Catholic relief in Iraq director, Father Mousa Adely. Topics: 1998 Ramadan, Interfaith, Muslim Day parade, Muslim Americans; Iraq refugees in Jordan, Muslim women project to assist homeless.)

(Aziz reviews Iranian film "Children of Heaven", S. Ahmed reviews conditions in Sudan criticizing media bias and interviews "Salam Sudan" peace organization Al-Tenai; Ibish report on Florida conference of American Muslim Alliance. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NJ-activist Dr Sapphire Ahmed, Hashem Al-Tenai, political observer Hussein Ibish, producer Jad Abumrad. Topics: Iranian film, Sudan, Muslim Americans, American Muslim Alliance.)

(Zogby reviews Arab Americans in local elections, NJ candidate G. Shamy shares his ideals and aims, Dr. Sayeed on strategies for Muslim Americans in local politics, Fernandez reports on success overturning secret evidence in case of Hani Khireddin. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NJ-candidate G. Shamy, Arab Amererican Institute director Jim Zogby (AAI), Agha Sayeed, head of Muslim American Alliance, civil rights attorney Regis Fernandez. Topics: American elections, Arab Americans, Rumi Sufi poetry, secret evidence, Muslim American civil rights.)

(Saad and Gage review detentions of US Muslims and fight against US government use of secret evidence, and calls from listeners; Abumrad's report from US Muslim conference Chicago. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: attorney Houeida Saad and Kit Gage of National Coalition to Protect Political Freedom (NCPPF), Jad Abumrad report. Topics: VA-based attorney Houeida Saad, civil rights, secret evidence, Muslim American rights, US Muslim conference.)

(Fr Adely appeals for relief for Iraq under sanctions and provides figures of Iraq refugees; Ben Yusuf reports on results of Arab American candidates across US; Ibish reviews Palestine-Israel negotiations Sharm El-Sheik meeting; Abumrad reports from Lebanon regarding political instability and needs. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Jad Abumrad, Asma Ben Yusuf of Arab American Institute (AAI), political observer Hussein Ibish, Catholic relief official in Jordan, Fr. Mousa Adley. Topics: Iraq, US bombing Iraq, Iraq relief, US elections, Arab American political candidates, Palestine-Israeli negotiations; Lebanon politics.)

(Bouziane reviews and interviews (French-English) Algerian Rai vocalist Cheb Mami, poet Handal speaks about her book "The Never Field," with readings. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Anissa Bouziane, Algerian vocalist Cheb Mami, NY-Based poet Nathalie Handal, political observer Hussein Ibish. Topics: Algeria, Rai music, Cheb Mami, Arab American literature, poetry, Arab women, Palestine, US policy.)

(Gonzalez's poetic music production for Ramadan, Jan Abumrad's reports on century athlete Mohammed Ali, Aziz reviews Ramadan Children's story; Nurridin leads discussion with Samad and Mohammed on diversity and Arab-centric Islam. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Jad Abumrad. Interviewees/Guests: Sufi musician Ibrahim Gonzalez, NJ-Seton Hall U. Prof Yusuf Nurridin, Kaseem Mohammed, Sayeed Abdul Samad. Topics: Ramadan, Islam, Mohammed Ali, Muslim Americans, African American Muslims.)

(A special Ramadan edition: Diouf, author of "Servants of Allah" on Muslim history in the Caribbean; guest children recite Qur'an, guide for fasting and observance. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NY-based author Sylvian Diouf, Women in Islam director Aisha Adawiya, NY-area Muslim children. Topics: Islam, Caribbean-American Muslim history, Qur'an, Ramadan.)

(A special Ramadan Edition (pt2), Sudan women's Islamic recitation, children's Qur'anic reading recitation; children reading Ramadan children's story; Gonzalez sufi music production. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NJ-Muslim rep Sapphire Ahmed, US-Sudanese children; Sufi musician Ibrahim Gonzalez. Topics: Islam, Ramadan, Sudan, Sudanese women, Muslim children; Sufi production.)

("Western Representations of the Muslim Woman," discussed by author Kahf. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: author, poet, and professor at University of Arkansas Mohja Kahf. Topics: Muslim women, Arab women, Oriental, media and literary images.)

(Al-Ashkar reports on attempts to recruit him as an FBI informant. Interviewees/Guests: Al-Ashkar, visiting Palestinian student in USA. Topics: Muslim and Arab civil rights, Palestinian student, harassment by FBI, US detention.)

(Arnove reports on bombing of Iraq and arrival of a decade of sanctions and growth of opposition to the embargo, criticism of US media and US policy; Flounders overviews global opposition to UN sanctions. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz.
