(Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon, featuring musician and composer Tarek Aboushi; poet and spoken word artist Suheir Hammad. Hosts/Producer: Dean Obeidallah, Maysoon Zayid. Interviewees/Guests: Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon. Topics: Arab American arts and comedy.)

(Poem from Dunia and Deen, Betool Khedari interviewed in Jordan on her book "A Sky So Close", Aziz and Abdellah discuss gender issues in contemporary Islam, listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Hassen Abdellah, Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Dunia and Deen Poetry CD, Iraqi novelist Betool Khedari. Topics: poetry, world music, Arab literature, Islam.)

(Ambassador to Algeria interviewed in Algiers talks about Shahrawi history and diplomacy to recognize Shahrawi national identity, Aziz commentary on religion and discrimination against women. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Shahrawi Ambassador Mohammed Beset. Topics: Shahrawi of Western Sahara, Polisario, Morocco, world music, women, religion.)

(Author Asra Nomani of "Standing Alone in Mecca" talks about Islam and her Hajj experience, Aziz report on Chinese Muslim women imams, world music, listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: author Asra Nomani of "Standing Alone in Mecca". Topics: Islam, The Hajj, Muslim authors, China Islam.)

(Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon, featuring scriptwriter Esma May of play "Mush"; hiphop artist and activist Iron Sheik. Hosts/Producer: Dean Obeidallah, Maysoon Zayid. Interviewees/Guests: Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon. Topics: Arab American arts and comedy.)

(Mehdi talks about forthcoming filmmakers conference, Salloum reports on his work, Kahf reads poem "This Soft Fascism" and talks about her work, Ghadban talks about Syria today and US policy to Syria. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: US-Arab filmmaker Anisa Mehdi, Canadian multi-media filmmaker Jayce Salloum, poet and professor Mohja Kahf, professor of Political Science Najib Ghadban. Topics: world music, Arab American filmmakers, Arab American literature, Syria.)

(Kahf and Mohammedi discuss the history of Hajjar mother of Ismael and her place in Islamic history, Kahf reads poem "Hajjar\'s Rite". Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Arkansas Poet and professor Mohja Kahf, poet and translator Rachida Mohammedi. Topics: Islamic history, Hajjar, The Hajj, world music.)

(Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon, featuring graphic artist Michael Kabbash; Arab American Street festival; Arab Heritage week organizers Sharab Sishijaki (sp.?) DJ Ibrahim Khal. Hosts/Producer: Dean Obeidallah, Maysoon Zayid. Interviewees/Guests: Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon. Topics: Arab American arts and comedy.)

(Jayyusi on developments contemporary Arabic fiction and Arab writers on release of new anthology, Laila Al-Arian updates us on the case against Sami Al-Arian persecuted by US government, Imam Bayram recalls persecution of Bosnian Muslims and current issues in Bosnia. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Jordan-based translator and scholar Salma K Jayyusi interviewed in Boston, journalist Laila Al-Arian, NY Bosnian Imam Bayram. Topics: Arab literature, Arab history civil rights, Palestine, Bosnia history, world music.)

(Jayyusi (part 3) on modern Arab literature, lit history, and relations between journalism and lit, poems by Amal Bishara and Kazim Ali, interview with Aliya Sousa (part 3) about Ahmed Sousa Iraqi intellectual. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Jordan-based translator and anthologist Salma K Jayyusi interviewed in Boston, Poets Amal Bishara and Kazim Ali, Iraqi economist Aliya Sousa in Baghdad. Topics: Arab literature, Arab American literature, Iraq, Iraqi intellectual Ahmed Sousa, world music.)

(Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon, featuring poet, playwright and anthology editor Nathalie Handal, filmmaker and director Hani Abu Assad, director of "Paradise Now" and "Rana\'s Wedding". Hosts/Producer: Dean Obeidallah, Maysoon Zayid. Interviewees/Guests: Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon. Topics: Arab American arts and comedy.)

(Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon, featuring film actor Hind Ayoub, from the film "Private"; comedian Rani Khalil. Hosts/Producer: Dean Obdeidallah, Maysoon Zayid. Interviewees/Guests: Fen Mejnoon with Dean and Maysoon. Topics: Arab American arts and comedy.)

(Mussin is director of SF-based "Aswat" orchestral and choral group speaking about the group and Arabic music history, Handel reads and speaks about playwriting and the Arab American theater scene in NY. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: SF-based Musician Saed Mussin, NY-based poet and playwright Nathalie Handal, author of "The Lives of Rain" and plays and anthologies. Topics: Arab American arts, music, music history, literature, world music.)

(Ahmed Hamdi reviews the history of journalism in Algeria and journalism studies in Algeria today. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Ahmed Hamid, Algerian prof of journalism, U. Algiers, Algeria. Topics: Algeria journalism, Media History.)

(Joudah reads (in Arabic and English) Darwish poetry selections from his book, "The Butterfly\'s Burden," of the work of Mahmoud Darwish. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: TX-based poet and translator Fady Joudah author of "The Butterfly\'s Burden". Topics: Mahmoud Darwish, Palestine.)

(Ashraf interviews operatic star Palestinian tenor Francisco Casanova in NY, with excerpts from his CDs. Hosts/Producer: Fatima Ashraf. Interviewees/Guests: Francisco Casanova, NY-based opera singer. Topics: music, Palestine.)

did.unittitle: Interviewees/Guests: Jamal Dijani, SF-based TV producer, community leader
did.abstract: (Jamal Dijani, TV producer of "Mosaic," talks about CA Arab American community. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Topics: Middle East, Arab American, media.)

dao.title: Interviewees/Guests: Jamal Dijani, SF-based TV producer, community leader (Access)

did.unittitle: Interviewees/Guests: Bisharat, SF-based lawyer and professor
did.abstract: (George Bisharat talks about SF and US Arab community needs, Palestine struggle. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Topics: Arab American community, Palestine.)

dao.title: Interviewees/Guests: Bisharat, SF-based lawyer and professor (Access)

did.unittitle: Interviewees/Guests: Dr. Jess Ghanem, SF-based psychologist, activist
did.abstract: (Jess Ghanem speaks about the Arab American community and its mission. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Topics: Arab American community, Palestine.)

dao.title: Interviewees/Guests: Dr. Jess Ghanem, SF-based psychologist, activist (Access)

did.unittitle: Interviewees/Guests: Afaf Kanafani, Palestine refugee, SF-based author
did.abstract: (Afaf Kanafani, San Francisco-based author on her early memoir, "Nadia, Captive of Hope". Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Topics: Arab American literature, memoir, women.)

dao.title: Interviewees/Guests: Afaf Kanafani, Palestine refugee, SF-based author (Access)

did.unittitle: Interviewees/Guests: Saed Muhhsin, SF-based musician, "swat" member
did.abstract: (Saed Muhhsin talks about Arab Music history and San Francisco-based Arab music activities. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Topics: Arab American community, music.)

dao.title: Interviewees/Guests: Saed Muhhsin, SF-based musician, "swat" member (Access)

did.abstract: (Faroque Khan reports on visit to Pakistan Kashmir after October earthquake, interview with Iraqi scientist Dr. Huda Ammash on her education in US and toxicity of Iraq environment due to UN sanctions. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NY-community leader Faroque Khan, Iraqi scientist Huda Ammash. Topics: Muslim Americans, Iraq post invasion, Pakistan Kashmir, world music.)

(John Sinno reports on history of Arab films and Arab American film, art films; Qumsiyeh reviews history and identity of Hamas and results of recent elections. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Mazen Qumsiya Palestinian observer, Seattle-based John Sinno film distributor. Topics: Palestine, Gaza, Palestinian elections, Arab and Arab American films, world music.)

(Nashishibi talks about her early life and search for South American family, Lawrence Joseph reads his poems and talks about his history, books, and work. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: SF-based community leader Alice Nashashibi, NY-poet and author Lawrence Joseph. Topics: Arab American history and community, Arab American literature.)

(Poet Shihabi, interviewed in 2005 in SF, reads poems and talks about her work and inspiration, Bashir Anastas describes work as curator of SF film festival. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: SF-based poet Deema Shihabi, SF-based film curator and community activist Bashir Anastas. Topics: Arab American literature, film, world music.)

(Guests discuss "Muslim women in the Public Square", interpretations of the Qur\'an, rights, Islamic history, women engaged in scholarship, listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Aisha Adawiya. Interviewees/Guests: Notre Dame U Prof. Asma Afsaruddin, NY-educator Debbie Al-Montasar, NYC attorney Najat Solat. Topics: Muslim American, women, Qur\'an recitation, Islamic history.)

(Ramallah based writer Amiry speaks with Aziz about her latest novel and life under occupation in the West Bank; Tamara Issak interviews musician and teacher Sami Aby Samys about Arab music and his career with music. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Palestinian architect and author Souad Amiry, violinist Sami Abu Samys director of "Zikrayat", intern Tamara Issak. Topics: Palestine, Arab literature, resistance to Israeli occupation, Arab music, world music.)

(Abdul Kader speaks about her book and the need of women to know their rights, Indonesian women recite \'nashid\', with listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Aisha Al-Adawiya. Interviewees/Guests: NJ attorney Abdul Kader author of "Muslim Women\'s Guide to Her Civil Rights". Topics: Muslim Americans, Muslim women, civil rights, world music, Muslim women recitation.)

(Interviewed in Oran, Algeria Prof Sohbi analyzes war in Iraq and US-Israeli policies, listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Algerian Prof. Military History Hassan Sohbi. Topics: Iraq, Algeria, US policy in Iraq and Middle East.)

(Aziz comments on lack of Muslim voice on genocide in South Sudan, report on Muslims in local elections, Issak reports on NJ-mayoral candidate race, Union leader Zahid Ali Sayed talks about Muslim community work, callins. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Zahid Ali Sayed, NY area Union leader, mayoral candidate M Khairallah. Topics: Darfur Sudan, Muslim Americans, local elections, community, world music.)

(Hanania talks about his research on history of Arabs in Chicago and journalism clips from public lecture by journalist Robert Fisk. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Hassen Abdellah. Interviewees/Guests: Chicago-based Arab American journalist Ray Hanania author of "Arabs of Chicagoland", intern Aydin Baltaci, Robert Fisk. Topics: fundraising, Arab American history.)

(Aydin Baltaci reviews films, Dr. Al-Hibri on her essay "Divine Justice and the Human Order in Islamic Perspective" relating to women and race issues, with questions by attorney Soleh. Hosts/Producer: Aisha Adawiya. Interviewees/Guests: US Professor of Islamic law Dr Azizah Al-Hibri. Topics: film reviews, Islamic law, women\'s rights, spiritual music.)

(Ashraf reads stats regarding Muslim American representation in various professions, then speaks with writer Haroon Mogul, editor Miral Sattar, photographer Naheed Choudhry, film student Hena Ashraf and chaplain Khalid Latif talk about inspiration choosing careers in arts and human services. Hosts/Producer: Fatima Ashraf. Interviewees/Guests: 4 young Muslims talks about their choice of non-traditional careers:-- Haroon Moghul, Miral Sattar, Naheed Choudhry, Hena Ashraf, Khalid Latif. Topics: world music, Muslim Americans, youth.)

(Fatima Ashraf reads Middle East news highlights, Andrea Assaf reads poems and reports on her performances and Arab American writers, Vina Malouf; Musra Masri reports new Israeli assault, and rebuilding Lebanon. Hosts/Producer: Fatima Ashraf. Interviewees/Guests: US-based writer performer Andrea Assaf, Vina Malouf of Save Lebanon, Lebanon reporter Musra Masri. Topics: Lebanon, Arab American literature, Middle East news report, world music.)

(Studio guests talk about programs available and planned in their Muslim communities. Hosts/Producer: Fatima Ashraf. Interviewees/Guests: young Muslims from the NY-NJ community, production assistance by Aydin Baltaci and Manaslu Gurung. Topics: Muslim Americans, youth, community, world music.)

(Anas Shallal interviewed at his center in DC talks about his goals, with comments by staff at Busboys and Poets, poet Zaid Shlah reads and talks about Iraqi poetry, world music. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: DC-based Iraqi businessman Anas Shallal, SF-based Iraq Poet Ziad Shlah author of poet collection Takasim. Topics: Arab Americans, Arab literature, Busboys and Poets.)

(Fatima Ashraf threads clips from interviews with Anais Khaleel, Amina McCloud, into a report on the role of Muslim Americans in 2004 US elections. Hosts/Producer: Fatima Ashraf. Interviewees/Guests: Anais Khaleel, DePaul University Professor of Islamic Studies Amina McCloud and author of "Transnational Muslims in American Society", NY community leader Faroque Khan. Topics: US local and national elections, Muslim Americans, world music.)

(Ashraf reviews stats of violence to women, guests are professional in women\'s affairs speaking about domestic in Muslim families and review different kinds of abuse and legal issues. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Fatima Ashraf. Interviewees/Guests: NY-area community women leaders Robina Diaz of "Turning Point-NY, social worker Salma Abu Garebi, Attorney Amina Khan. Topics: Ramadan, women, Muslim women, civil rights, women\'s rights.)

(Guests and hosts testify to the personal significance of Ramadan, and education of the wider community. Hosts/Producer: Fatima Ashraf, Aisha Adawiya. Interviewees/Guests: Ramadan special program, NY-area Sarah Sayid, Nour Amatula, Potri Rankmanis. Topics: Ramadan, women, Muslim Americans, world music, spiritual devotion.)

(Interview with tenor Francisco Casanova about his life and career by Fatima Ashraf. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Fatima Ashraf. Interviewees/Guests: US-Arab-Dominican tenor Francisco Shaheen Casanova. Topics: world music, Islam, women, Muslim Eid.)

(Dean Obeidallah announces details of NY Arab American comedy festival, author and professor Orfalea talks about his latest book "The Arab Americans: A History" and writing career, Seattle-based commentator reviews conditions of Turkmen in Kirkuk city under US occupation in Iraq. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Arab American author Greg Orfalea, AA comedians Maysoon Zayid and Dean Obeidallah, Orhane Katane on Iraqi Turkmen. Topics: Arab American literature, world Music, Iraq, Turkmen of Iraq.)

(Haroon Moghul talks about his new book, novel "The Order of Light" and issues of Muslim American identity, Nabila Mango reports on her SF-music group "Aswat" as a community integrating activity. Hosts/Producer: Fatima Ashraf, Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: South Asian Muslim author Haroon Moghul, SF-based community music leader Nabila Mango. Topics: world music, Muslim American, Muslim author, Arab music.)

(Khalil Jassem reports on US persecution and govt raids of his Michigan-based charity organization and comment on this by attorney Sherif Akhil. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: SF-based radio host and activist Jess Ghanem, Michigan US Charity leader Khalil Jassem; attorney Sherif Akhil. Topics: Muslim Americans, civil rights, Arab American activism, media, world music.)

(Ketane comments on status of Turkmen in Iraq under US occupation, Donia Milli\'s discusses making her film "Uprooted" in Palestine, SF -based activists Addasi and Kayali report on their community work. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: US-Iraqi-Turkmen commentator Orhan Ketane, filmmaker Donia Milli, SF based Addasi and Kayali. Topics: Iraqi Turkmen, Arab American filmmaker, Palestine, community activism, world music.)

(Music by Arab children, books and films for young people shared by our Tahrir staff, listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: holiday special, Tahrir staff Ashraf and Baltaci discuss books and films. Topics: books and films for young people shared by our Tahrir staff.)

(Three Arab women poets Kahf, Adnan, and AbuSaba read their work and explore Arab life and heritage in their writing. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: poet professor Mohja Kahf, poet artist Etel Adnan, poet Laila AbuSaba. Topics: Arab American literature, poetry, Lebanon, Palestine, music of Marcel Khalife.)

(Fatima Ashraf speaks with Pakistani-American artist Shikoh about her work and network of Asian artists especially portrayal of Muslim woman's headscarf, Aziz engages Kalhor in one of many interviews, speaking about his work and collaborations, DH Melhem reads poems and talks. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Iranian virtuoso Kayhan Kalhor, NJ-based media artist Asma Shikoh, NY-based poet DH Melhem. Topics: art, Pakistan, Muslim Americans, Iran, Arab American poetry.)

(A collection of segments: five musicians interviewed by Aziz over the years, with excerpts of their work. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Shahram Shiva, Kayhan Kalhor, Ilham Madfaii, Simon Shaheen, Farid Makloufi. Topics: music, Iran, Sufi, Iraq, Palestine, Algeria.)
(Aziz interviews Jazz saxophonist SF-based Hafez Modir, on his jazz and fusion with Iranian traditions)
(Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: SF-based musician, saxophonist Hafez Modir. Topics: music, Iran, Hafez Modir.)
(Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: SF-based musician Hafez Modir. Topics: music, Iran, Hafez Modir.)

(California based Palestinian Abu Gazale talks about his political ambitions and run for congress, Asma Sayeed on using Malcolm X in teaching school history; Al-Hibri talks about Malcolm X and explains work and aims of Karamah law leadership organization. Hosts/Producer: Aisha Adawiya. Interviewees/Guests: Special on Malcolm X, Asma Sayeed and Azizah Al-Hibri, SF-based citizen and political candidate Abu Gazale. Topics: US election candidate, Arab American, Malcolm X, spiritual music.)

(Mattawa announces forthcoming RAWI-Arab American Literary conference, Progress Theater (Muslim-American) members on its founding and production at New York's Henry Street Settlement with performance clips, music. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: U. Mich poet and professor Khaled Mattawa, Progress Theater members Crystal Chanell Trescott and Aron Goodson, Maisha McQueen. Topics: Arab American literature, world music, Muslim Americans, racism, theater.)

(Aziz reviews 2 Iranian films, "Color of Paradise" and "A Time For Drunken Horses"; Abdellah and guests talk about the significance of "Jamestown", racial issues and African American history, listener calls. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Hassen Abdellah. Interviewees/Guests: NJ community members Dwain Wright and Wanda Aiken. Topics: Iran, film reviews, Muslim Americans, NewJersey.)

(Mai Faraj reads from Kanafani\'s classic novel, "Men in The Sun," with discussion about Kanifani\'s political philosophy, reviews books, Habeeb Salloum talks about his research on Arab language, starting with Arab contributions both to English and to Spanish. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: translator Mai Faraj, Canada-based Arab author Habeeb Salloum. Topics: Arabic language, Arab literature education, Palestinian writer Ghassan Kanafani, Aziz review books by Arab writers, Habeeb Salloum.)

(Poem of Iraq" by Iraqi professor and poet Bushra Bustani, commentary by Mohammedi; Sokkary comments on Arabic language in Arab culture and colonialist historical obstacles to the language, world music. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Topics: Arab language in Arabic and in translation, teaching Arabic.)

(Longer interview with Mohammedi, who reviews characteristic of Arabic with some critical remarks. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Topics: Arab language in Arabic and in translation (first of a series).)

(We play the Arabic instructional tape by Suhair Sokkary, Abdellah reviews Middlebury's Arab language program talks about the nature and aims of their program, Ginan Rauf explains classical and colloquial differences in Arabic. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Middlebury VT Professor and Director of Arabic Language program Mahmoud Abdallah, NJ-Arab literature scholar Ginan Rauf. Topics: Arab language in Arabic and in translation, teaching Arabic, world music.)

(Clip by Abu Arab in Arabic, Prof. Brustan talks about aims and character of the Arabic language textbooks for \'living language\', Laila Kamalik discusses being a student of Arabic, from Tahrir archive Jayyusi speaks on modern Arabic fiction. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Palestinian poet Abu Arab, U. Texas Professor of Arabic and co-author of "Al-Kitab" series Kristen Brustad; Middlebury Arab language teacher Laila Kamalik, translator Salma K Jayyusi. Topics: Arab language in Arabic and in translation, teaching Arabic, world music.)

(Iranian-American saxophonist Modirzadeh plays and talks about his jazz and Iranian roots; media translator and critic Ghazi reports on the range of Arab language media, SF-Poet AbuSaba reads poems (in Arabic) and his life. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: SF-based guests--Jazz musician Hafiz Modirzadeh, Link-TV Jalal Ghazi, FS-based poet Elias Abu Saba. Topics: world music, Arab media, media criticism, Arab literature, Iran, Lebanon.)

(Guests review ideals from which they were drawn to law as a profession, and pursuit of civil rights for Muslims, with direct effects of 911 attacks on NY area Muslims and their work for CAIR. Hosts/Producer: Aisha Adawiya. Interviewees/Guests: CAIR NY- civil rights attorneys Alia Latif and Maya Saya Akhbar. Topics: civil rights, Muslim Americans, law, Muslim women, CAIR, world music.)

(Ghazi offers critical review of TV satellite programs in Arabic with some aired on "Mosaic" on Link TV, Kitane reports on bombing in Tel Affar in North Iraq and threat of destabilization, and threats to Turkmen. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: SF-based journalist Jalal Ghazi, US-based Iraqi Turkmen Orhan Kitane. Topics: Arabic language media, changing journalism in Arab World, Middle East, Iraq, Iraqi Turkmen, occupation of Iraq, world music.)

(Evelyn Shakir, author of "Bint Arab", a collection of short stories, Aziz reviews recent international films. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Boston-based author Evelyn Shakir. Topics: Arab American literature, Lebanon, Iraq, war, films, film reviews.)

(Fady Joudah reads and explains the poetry of Mahmoud Darwish (English and Arabic), El-Sultany discusses teaching US view and bias regarding Arabs in American, author Sylvian Diouf talks about the history of Muslims in the Americas. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: TX-based poet translator Fady Joudah, NY-based author Sylvian Diouf author of "Servants of Allah", U. Michigan Professor of Comparative Literature Evelyn Al-Sultany. Topics: poetry, Mahmoud Darwish, Arab American community, civil rights, media criticism, racism, world music.)

(Aziz interviews Susan AbuHawa, author of "The Scar of David"; musician Hafez Modir on jazz compositions. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Susan AbuHawa, PA-based novelist, SF-Based jazz musician Hafez Modir. Topics: Palestine, Iran, music, Arab American literature.)

(Omar Mohammedi reviews cases against Muslim Americans and rise of discrimination and mistreatment of Muslims in schools etc., interns Malaika and Hanadi talks about her work, Salaita talks about RAWI conf of Arab American writers, poet Kim Jensen about teaching. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: NY Attorney Omar Mohammedi, Author/Virginia Tech Professor of English Literature Steven Salaita; US-based poet Kim Jensen. Topics: civil rights, harassment, racism, Arab American literature, Muslim Americans.)

(Donia Mili interviews "Palestine Blues" filmmaker Sinoket, Aziz interviews poet Marian Haddad on her work. Hosts/Producer: Donia Mili, Barabara Nimri Aziz. Interviewees/Guests: Nida Sinokat, Palestine filmmaker: Marian Haddad, TX-based poet. Topics: Palestine, film, Arab American lit, poetry.)

(Warren gives testimony of NY police abuse experience, leading Iraqi poet Nazik Malaika who died recently is remembered by Professor Al-Toma with archival clip by Salma K Jayyusi discussing Malaika's significance in Arab Literature. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Sarah Malaika. Interviewees/Guests: Indiana U. Arab Literature Professor Saleh Al-Toma; NY-based attorney Tarif Warren; NJ Ocean Country College professor and literature critic Maysa Hayward. Topics: Arab literature, Nazik Malaika, Muslim American, racism, civil rights, world music.)

(Ali Koshak summarizes status of Iraqi Turkmen, Kirkuk City and bombing of Imerli town, Moniza Khokhar announces launch of "Elan" magazine for young Muslim American professionals; Layla Al-Maleh discusses English-language Arab Diaspora literature. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Sarah Malaika. Interviewees/Guests: Ali Koshak of Turkmen Institute, NJ-based Asian American editor of "Elan" Moniza Khokhar, Kuwait Arab Literature Prof Layla Al-Maleh. Topics: world music, Iraq, Turkmen, literature, Muslim American, Arab Diaspora writers.)

(Nasri Malek jokes with us in studio about Arab comedy, KPFA radio hosts Kathouda and Boustani report on their experience in media as radio hosts. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Sarah Malaika. Interviewees/Guests: NY-based comedian Nasri Malek, DC-Based radio hosts Ryme Katkhouda and LA-based Don Bustani. Topics: world music, media, Arab American arts.)

(Nasr Musa (originally Jordanian) took up Khaliji (Gulf) music on the oud and explains difference of Gulf music and that of other Arab areas, documentary from NY-Arab street fair produced by Malaika, Darraj reads and talks about her work. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Sarah Malaika. Interviewees/Guests: Musicians from the Gulf Arab region, CA-based musician Nasr Musa; PA-based author/editor Susan Muaddi Darraj author of "Inheritance of Exile". Topics: world music, Gulf Arab music, Arab American literature.)

(Hands of Henna" testimony by 4 young women produced by Sarah Malaika, Kashavar elaborates on her book "Jasmin and Stars" a critical view of the presentations of Iranian and other Muslim women in schools and books. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Sarah Malaika. Interviewees/Guests: NY Muslim women Regina, Sarah, Khadija, Shmeh henna party; St Louis Wash U Prof of Comparative Literature and author Fatima Kashavar. Topics: world music, Arab American literature, Muslim women, media, Iran, Muslim literature, world music.)

(Nashef\'s film "Detroit Unleaded" describes her short film (see 2013 interview) her past and future plans, Aziz comments on Brooklyn\'s Gibran School scandal around public harassment, listener calls and commentary. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Sarah Malaika. Interviewees/Guests: Detroit-based filmmaker Rolla Nashef. Topics: NYC Arab School, anti-Arab harassment, Arab Americans, film, world music.)

(Antoon reads poems from "Baghdad Blues" and wars and sanctions in Iraq and expressing Arab culture, world music, Khalil Ben Dib reviews his career as a cartoonist and his candidacy for US president. Hosts/Producer: Barabara Nimri Aziz, Sarah Malaika. Interviewees/Guests: NY-based author Prof Sinan Antoon; SF-based cartoonist and radio host Khalil Ben Dib author of "Mission Accomplished". Topics: Arab literature, American literature, comedy, journalism, world music.)

(Burns reviews with Sarah M. aim and some artists in current NY exhibition "Cultural Interpretations", then artists Nuha Al-Saidi and Haifa Bint Khadi discuss their work, Sarah Malaika interviews Nsenga Knight about her multi-media work "As the Veil Turns". Hosts/Producer: Sarah Malaika, Saadia Aslam. Interviewees/Guests: visual artists Nuha Al-Saidi and Haifa Bint Khadi, and curator Milli Burns; NY-multi-media artist Nsenga Knight. scopecontent.p: The News broadcasts series (120 digital audio files (online)) primarily document Aziz's involvement in non-Radio Tahrir programs, particularly WBAI Radio programs like Behind the News and TalkBack. Material in this series includes radio episodes, episode segments, commentaries, interviews, and news reports.
Note that the "Other reports and programs" subseries is initially arranged alphabetically and then further arranged chronologically.

Topics: Iraq, US policy and torture in Iraq, invasion Middle East .)

scopecontent.p: The Interviews and related material series (100 digital audio files (online)) primarily consists of interviews conducted by Dr. Barbara Nimri Aziz. Many of these interviews appear to be unedited (i.e. original). Also present in this series are miscellaneous documentaries, lectures, literary readings, and recitations.

relatedmaterial.p: The Bentley Historical Library houses the following related collections: Radio Tahrir Web Archives and Radius of Arab-American Writers, Inc. records.

Additionally, a modified version of the metadata spreadsheet used to create this finding aid—and which contains further information about the bulk of the digital materials in this collection—can be found in this Deep Blue collection.
